page.title: List of Seventh-day Adventist secondary schools

revisions.rev:
{{Expand list|date=July 2009}} {{Infobox Organization |name = Seventh-day Adventists Educational System |image = Shenandoah Valley Academy pictured in 1924.jpg |image_border = |size = <!-- default 200 --> |alt = <!-- alt text; see [[WP:ALT]] --> |caption = | main_classification = [[Protestant]] | orientation = [[Adventist]] | polity = [[Government of the Seventh-day Adventist Church|Modified presbyterian polity]] |map = <!-- optional --> |msize = <!-- map size, optional, default 200px --> |malt = <!-- map alt text --> |mcaption = <!-- optional --> |abbreviation = |motto = |formation = |extinction = <!-- date of extinction, optional --> |type = Religious/Non-Profit |status = <!-- ad hoc, treaty, foundation, etc --> |purpose = |headquarters = |location = [[Silver Spring, Maryland|Silver Spring]], [[Maryland]], [[United States|USA]] |coords = <!-- Coordinates of location using a coordinates template --> |region_served =Worldwide |membership = |language = <!-- official languages --> |leader_title = |leader_name = |main_organ = <!-- gral. assembly, board of directors, etc --> |parent_organization = [[General Conference of Seventh-day Adventists]] |affiliations = |num_staff = |num_volunteers = |budget = |website = [http://www.nadadventist.org/ www.nadadventist.org] |remarks = }}
The '''[[Seventh-day Adventist Church]]''' runs a large [[Seventh-day Adventist education|educational system]] throughout the world. As of 2008, 1678<ref name="Statistics">[http://www.adventist.org/world_church/facts_and_figures/index.html.en Seventh-day Adventist Statistics]. Office of Statistics & Archives. Retrieved 2009-08-05</ref> '''[[secondary school]]s''' are affiliated with the Church. Some schools offer both elementary and secondary education.
{{TOC left}}
